intro: Hieracium macrurum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium macrurum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
